DataElement.preferredName: Therapy Discontinue Current Course Due To Schedule Lumbar Puncture Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text field to record if the current course of therapy was discontinued due to a scheduled lumbar puncture.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapy Discontinue Current Course Due To Schedule Lumbar Puncture
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding._Caused by or resulting from._An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur._A procedure in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid or to give drugs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Current Course Due To Schedule Lumbar Puncture Discontinue
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.:Caused by or resulting from.:An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A procedure in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid or to give drugs.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.
An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

An invasive procedure in which a hollow needle is introduced through an intervertebral space in the lower back to access the subarachnoid space in order to sample cerebrospinal fluid or to administer medication.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
